intro: Alkanna cordifolia, commonly known as the heartleaf alkanna, is a perennial shrub native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and produces clusters of yellow flowers in the spring. The plant is part of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Its roots are known for their deep red color and have been used historically in traditional medicine. Alkanna cordifolia thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy plant in arid environments.
